key.name: initialized
key.description: Whether the extension has been initialized with default values

key.name: panel-opacity
key.description: Adjust the transparency of the main panel (taskbar). Lower values create more glass-like effect.

key.name: menu-opacity
key.description: Adjust the transparency of popup menus. Creates modern frosted glass appearance when combined with blur effects.

key.name: override-panel-color
key.description: When enabled, use the selected override color for the panel background. If 'Override popup color' is disabled, this color is also used for popup menus.

key.name: choose-override-panel-color
key.description: Select the background color to use for the panel when 'Override panel color' is enabled. Supports transparency (alpha channel).

key.name: override-popup-color
key.description: When enabled, use the selected override color for popup menu backgrounds instead of the panel color. Requires 'Override panel color' to be enabled for full effect.

key.name: choose-override-popup-color
key.description: Select the background color to use for popup menus when 'Override popup color' is enabled. Supports transparency (alpha channel).

key.name: border-radius
key.description: Rounded corners for panels and menus. Used as fallback when auto-detect fails or finds inconsistent values. Set to 0 for completely flat appearance.

key.name: apply-panel-radius
key.summary: Apply border radius to main panel
key.description: Enable rounded corners on taskbar for modern appearance. May look odd at screen edges depending on your theme.

key.name: panel-margin
key.description: Horizontal margin for floating panel effect. Set to 0 for pinned (edge-to-edge) mode, or 4-32 for floating panel separated from screen edges. Border radius only applies when margin is greater than 0.

key.name: auto-detect-radius
key.description: Automatically detect and use border-radius from current theme for consistent appearance. When enabled, the extension analyzes your theme to match its design.

key.name: auto-color-extraction
key.description: Automatically detect and apply colors from your wallpaper when it changes. Extracts dominant colors for panel/popup backgrounds and accent colors for borders.

key.name: blur-radius
key.description: Controls the intensity of the blur effect. Higher values create a stronger, more diffused glass-like appearance (e.g., 30px+ for foggy effect), while lower values (1-10px) produce sharper, more subtle blurring for a cleaner look.

key.name: blur-saturate
key.description: Adjusts color vibrancy in the blurred background. Values above 1.0 make colors more vivid and lively (for brighter, more energetic glass effect), while below 1.0 create muted, desaturated tones for a softer, more elegant appearance.

key.name: blur-contrast
key.description: Controls the difference between light and dark areas in the blur. Higher values (above 1.0) enhance sharpness and depth for a more defined, modern look, while lower values soften the effect for a smoother, less harsh glass appearance.

key.name: blur-brightness
key.description: Modifies the overall lightness of the blurred layer. Increase above 1.0 for a brighter, more illuminated glass effect (ideal for light themes), or decrease below 1.0 for darker, moodier tones that blend better with dark backgrounds.

key.name: blur-background
key.description: Adds a tint overlay to the blur effect. Use semi-transparent colors (e.g., light blue for cool tones or warm orange for cozy feel) to customize the glass appearance - higher opacity for stronger tint, lower for subtle enhancement.

key.name: blur-border-color
key.description: Sets the color of the subtle border framing the blurred elements. Choose white/light colors for a clean, modern edge, or darker tones for better contrast - adjust opacity for softer or more defined borders.

key.name: blur-border-width
key.description: Defines the thickness of the border around blurred elements. Thicker borders (3-5px) create a more prominent frame for emphasis, while thinner (0-1px) or none (0px) give a seamless, integrated glass look.

key.name: shadow-strength
key.description: Controls the spread radius of box-shadow effects - how wide the outer glow appears around panels and menus. 0.0 = no visible shadow, 0.3 = subtle depth (12px, recommended), 0.5 = medium halo (20px), 0.8 = wide glow (32px). Works independently of shadow color opacity.

key.name: shadow-color
key.description: Sets the base color of shadows, automatically adjusted for light/dark themes. Supports full RGBA color specification for custom shadow colors. Default is white for light themes, black for dark themes.

key.name: blur-opacity
key.description: Controls the transparency of the entire blur layer. Higher values (0.8-1.0) make the glass effect more prominent and solid, while lower values (0.1-0.5) create a lighter, more ethereal appearance that blends seamlessly with the background.

key.name: enable-alttab-styling
key.description: Apply transparency and blur effects to Alt-Tab window switcher. Creates a consistent glass appearance for the application switcher.

key.name: hide-tray-icon
key.description: Hide the transparency control icon from the system tray. You can still access settings through GNOME Settings > Extensions.

key.name: notifications-enabled
key.description: Show desktop notifications for theme changes, color extraction, and other extension events. Disable for silent operation.

key.name: enable-blur
key.description: Apply blur effects to transparent elements for a modern glass-like appearance

key.name: enable-zorin-integration
key.description: Automatically detect and enhance Zorin OS shell components with advanced styling

key.name: zorin-tint-strength
key.description: Controls the intensity of Zorin theme color tint overlay (0% = completely removed/neutral, 50% = half intensity, 100% = original theme). Only affects Zorin themes (ZorinBlue, ZorinGreen, ZorinRed, etc.). Lower values create more neutral appearance while retaining theme character.

key.name: enable-overlay-theme
key.description: Create and use a custom GTK theme overlay that inherits from your current theme with CSSGnomme modifications

key.name: overlay-source-theme
key.description: Name of the GTK theme to use as base for the overlay theme

key.name: original-user-theme
key.description: Stores the user's original GTK theme name before activating overlay (for restoration)

key.name: original-shell-theme
key.description: Stores the user's original GNOME Shell theme name before activating overlay (for restoration)

key.name: overlay-auto-update
key.description: Automatically update overlay theme CSS when settings change (2 second debounce)

key.name: manual-apply-trigger
key.description: Internal flag toggled to trigger manual theme apply from prefs UI

key.name: trigger-color-extraction
key.description: Internal flag toggled to trigger manual color extraction from wallpaper

key.name: trigger-recreate-overlay
key.description: Internal flag toggled to trigger complete overlay theme recreation

key.name: auto-switch-color-scheme
key.description: Automatically filter theme dropdown to show only themes matching current system light/dark mode (prefer-dark → only dark themes, default/light → only light themes). When disabled, all themes are shown regardless of color-scheme.

key.name: full-auto-mode
key.summary: Full Auto Mode - Wallpaper Controls All Colors
key.description: When enabled, wallpaper color extraction controls ALL styling including blur effects (border, background, shadow). Standard mode: theme controls blur effects, wallpaper controls panel/popup. Full Auto: wallpaper controls everything.

key.name: debug-logging
key.description: Enable detailed logging for troubleshooting extension issues. Check terminal output with 'journalctl -f' for detailed information.
